title: `derive(Default)` for struct with `Option<T>` field gives error
body:
I tried this code:

```rust
#[derive(Default)]
struct Data<V> {
    data: Option<V>,
}

struct Foo {}

fn main() {
    let _data = Data::<Foo>::default();
}
```

I expected to see this compiles.

Instead, I got error:
```log
error[E0599]: the function or associated item `default` exists for struct `Data<Foo>`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied
 --> src/main.rs:9:30
  |
2 | struct Data<V> {
  | --------------
  | |
  | function or associated item `default` not found for this
  | doesn't satisfy `Data<Foo>: Default`
...
6 | struct Foo {}
  | ---------- doesn't satisfy `Foo: Default`
...
9 |     let _data = Data::<Foo>::default();
  |                              ^^^^^^^ function or associated item cannot be called on `Data<Foo>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds
  |
note: trait bound `Foo: Default` was not satisfied
 --> src/main.rs:1:10
  |
1 | #[derive(Default)]
  |          ^^^^^^^ unsatisfied trait bound introduced in this `derive` macro
  = note: the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
          `Foo: Default`
          which is required by `Data<Foo>: Default`
  = help: items from traits can only be used if the trait is implemented and in scope
  = note: the following trait defines an item `default`, perhaps you need to implement it:
          candidate #1: `Default`
help: consider annotating `Foo` with `#[derive(Default)]`
  |
6 | #[derive(Default)]
  |
```

### Meta
`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.62.0 (a8314ef7d 2022-06-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a8314ef7d0ec7b75c336af2c9857bfaf43002bfc
commit-date: 2022-06-27
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.62.0
LLVM version: 14.0.5
```
P.S. I get this error at least a year on Windows / GNU/Linux and MacOS. I just didn't care and implemented `Default` manually.

P.S.S. Is this a duplicate of some other issue? I tried to search already opened issues, but didn't find such issue.
